item.description: About I am a Lecturer in Political Economy at the Department of Political Economy at King’s College London and proud father of a lovely daughter. Since March 2022 I am the Academic Convenor of the ECPR Methods School. I am also a member of the editorial board of SN Social Sciences. My main research interests are in the fields of Political Economy and Political Science. I focus on understanding the role of institutions and their impact on strategic interactions in politics, in particular regarding lobbying, legislative politics, as well as bargaining and political decision-making.

Office hours Tuesday: 15.00-16.00 Thursday: 14.00-15.00 Book here Contact details Postal address: King’s College London Department of Political Economy Bush House North East 30 Aldwych London WC2B 4BG United Kingdom Office: Virginia Woolf Building 22 Kingsway London WC2B 6LE Room 3.37 Email: sebastian.1.koehler@kcl.ac.uk Office Phone: +44 (0)20 7870 3662 Matrix: @sk3551:matrix.org XMPP/Jabber: sebkoehle@xmpp.is View Larger Map Personal website at King’s
CV You can download my CV here: Previous Next     / [pdf] View the PDF file here.

Research Publications Peer Reviewed Stockemer, Daniel/Koehler, Sebastian/Lentz, Tobias. 2018. “Data Access and Transparency: New insights from the political behavior literature.” PS: Political Science and Politics 51 (4): 799–803. Koehler, Sebastian/König, Thomas. 2015. “Fiscal Governance in the Eurozone: How Effectively Does the Stability and Growth Pact Limit Governmental Debt in the Euro Countries?” Po- litical Science Research and Methods 03(2): 329-352. Books Koehler, Sebastian. 2019. “Lobbying, Political Uncertainty and Policy Outcomes”. London & New York: Palgrave Macmillan.
